intro: Mastixia cuneata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved mastixia, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by small, fleshy fruits. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and horticultural research.
